title: Lindsey Vonn Has Successful Third Surgery After Olympic Crash
snippets: Lindsey Vonn says she is "making progress" after having a successful third surgery on the broken leg she sustained in a crash at the Winter Olympics on Sunday.
Lindsey Vonn had a "successful" third surgery on her broken left leg following her downhill crash at the Olympics.

Vonn posted an update

Vonn posted an update on Instagram that included photos of her giving a thumbs up sign in her hospital bed with a metal frame attached to her leg. The 41-year-old Vonn crashed 13 seconds into her run during Sunday’s race at the Milan Cortina Games and was airlifted off the course by helicopter. Nine

CORTINA D’AMPEZZO, Italy — Lindsey Vonn had a “successful” third surgery on her broken left leg following her downhill crash at the Olympics, the American skier said Wednesday. Vonn posted an update on Instagram that included photos of her giving a thumbs up sign in her hospital bed with a metal frame attached to her leg. “I had my third surgery today and it was successful. Success today has a completely different meaning than it did a few days ago,” Vonn said. “I’m making progress and while it is slow, I know I’ll be OK.” The 41-year-old Vonn crashed 13 seconds into her run during Sunday’s...

title: NBA Suspends Four Players After Pistons Hornets Brawl
snippets: The NBA has suspended Detroit's Isaiah Stewart and Jalen Duren and Charlotte's Miles Bridges and Moussa Diabate for their roles in Monday's brawl.

Detroit Pistons forward Isaiah Stewart was suspended seven games by the NBA and three others involved in a brawl between Detroit and Charlotte were also banned by the league on Wednesday.Charlotte Hornets forwards Miles Bridges and Moussa Diabate were each suspended four games for fighting and escal

CHARLOTTE, N.C. — Detroit centre Isaiah Stewart was suspended seven games by the NBA on Wednesday, while three other players were also penalized for their roles in a fight during a game between the Pistons and Charlotte Hornets . Hornets forwards Miles Bridges and Moussa Diabaté were each suspended four games for fighting and escalating the altercation, while Pistons centre Jalen Duren got two games for initiating the altercation and fighting, the league announced. But the heaviest penalty went to Stewart, with the league saying it was based in part on his “repeated history of unsportsmanlike...
